meanings.definition: Administering the Christian rite of baptism to someone.
meanings.sent1: The priest was baptizing the baby in the church.
meanings.sent2: The pastor will be baptizing new members next Sunday.
meanings.sent3: The duck thought it was baptizing its ducklings in the pond.
meanings.sent4: The rain was baptizing the earth with its gentle touch.
meanings.sent5: The sun seemed to be baptizing the sky with its golden rays.

meanings.definition: Immersing in water as a religious rite.
meanings.sent1: She was baptizing the believers in the river.
meanings.sent2: The priest was baptizing the crowd during the ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The kids pretended they were baptizing each other in the pool.
meanings.sent4: The storm was baptizing the town with heavy rain.
meanings.sent5: The ocean waves were baptizing the shore with their constant flow.

meanings.definition: Initiating or dedicating someone to a new experience or belief.
meanings.sent1: The mentor was baptizing the new employees into the company culture.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was baptizing the students into the world of literature.
meanings.sent3: The chef felt like he was baptizing the trainees into the art of cooking.
meanings.sent4: The music festival was baptizing the attendees into the world of live performances.
meanings.sent5: The adventure park was baptizing the visitors into the thrill of extreme sports.
